results.title: Volcanoes, earthquakes, and other earth movements
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Goldberg-Werrenrath Productions
results.brief_description: Indicates that volcanoes and earthquakes are evidence of a natural process called plate tectonics. Shows how to chart part movements of these crustal plates and how to make predictions about their movements. The program also uses excellent location film such as the eruption of the Mt St Helens volcano in Norther America. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.description: Indicates that volcanoes and earthquakes are evidence of a natural process called plate tectonics. results.title: Tree of survival
results.creator_credit: Abdellatif Ben Ammar and United Nations Films
results.brief_description: Examines the causes of the spread of the desert in the Sahel region in Niger and shows the migration of the people of the artea to the town. Concentrates on the positive action being taken to enable the people to survive in the rural area such as tree planting.

results.title: Tomorrow's world
results.brief_description: Looks at the world population situation. Examines the history of world population growth, food production, and family planning schemes in the third world. Contrast family planning programs in Tunisia and Thailand and outlines various methods of family planning. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Monkey business: primates
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Chris O'Rourke and Victoria. Education Dept. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: Discusses features common to the three main groups of primates. Also provides a behind-the scenes look at the work of the keepers in the primate department of Melbourne zoo.

results.title: Meeting of minds: the mentor program
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Ministry of Education

video_links.name: Meeting of minds: the mentor program

results.brief_description: This program explores four mentor-student relationships. Each relationship is unique and serves to demonstrate the versatility of the mentor concept. The students are shown in their home and school environment. Administrative processes involved in the mentor program are also illustrated.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Ministry of Education

results.title: Zoo with class
results.creator_credit: James Mann and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of all aspects of the Melbourne Zoo Education Service. Looks at its philosophy on environmental education, the teaching programmes, curriculum developments and cosultancy. The program also reveals how the zoo education service can become an extension of the classroom and seeks to enable teachers to plan school-based environmental education programs in which the zoo school plays an integral role.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Mann and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: Real maths and school maths: can we close the gap?
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: Indonesian cuisine
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Education Dept. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: Focusing on a family of Indonesian immigrants and their Indonesian student guest, this program shows how Indonesians in Australia seek to preserve their culture through their cuisine and through cultural events which demonstrate their music, dress and customs.

results.title: Western Samoa: the best of both worlds?
results.brief_description: Explores the changes occuring in Western Samoa which give young people the choice between the “modern” world of the capital city, Alpia and traditional village life. Explains how each family member has a particular role to perform within the structured village society.
